p: Aromatic plants EOs are known to be mycostatic or fungicidal and represent a potential source of new antimycotics [ 49]. In view of the increasing resistance to the classical antimycotics, the EOs and their active constituents may be beneficial in the management of mycoses, especially dermatophytosis [ 50]. In the present study, the L. pubescens EO showed strong activity against M. canis, T. rubrum, T. mentagrophytes, and E. floccosum as indicated by their PI, MIC, MFC, and EC 50 values ( Figure 3).
